summary: Certified Financial Planner specializing in retirement planning and wealth management; property development and management; construction project management. Formerly technology exploitation program manager for Joint Special Operations Command (JSOC) and the USSOCOM Science and Technology (S&T) Liaison (LNO) to JSOC. Prior Director of Security for AMTI, a DOD contractor with 550 employees. Fully qualified DoD security officer and foreign disclosure and export compliance official. 21 years military as Pilot-in-Command, Chief - Command and Control, Nuclear Surety Officer, Plans Officer, and Chief of Requirements and Acquisition at JSOC. Transition Manager for the USSOCOM technology demonstrations; capture lead / coordinator for several winning proposals.

title: Regional Interagency Integrator
description: Performs duties in support of the J33 Global Support Group - PACOM and the Global Mission Support Center (GMSC), including CENTCOM, EUCOM, AFRICOM, PACOM, NORTHCOM, and SOUTHCOM. Integrates Interagency (IA) authorities and capabilities into a whole of government approach to discreet Special Operation Forces (SOF) problem sets. Facilitates synchronization of war on terrorism planning and operations by maintaining situational awareness of all relevant operations, plans, and activities and advising J33 leadership of significant developments. Supports the client collaborative information enterprise by coordinating with all relevant sources of information to ensure the complete and transparent exchange of operationally relevant information between TSOC, component, sub-component, the IA, ISCC, and GMSC. Develops, reviews, and evaluates analyses of alternatives and course of action development for operational and support issue resolution, provide liaison and coordination among all participants during the execution of time sensitive planning (TSP), contributes to mission planning by analyzing and fusing all-source information and reporting this information to government lead for the TSP event, participates in deliberate and time sensitive planning efforts, and provides overall information or knowledge management for deliberate and contingency mission planning support. Processes and facilitates the exchange of deliberate and time-sensitive requests for information (RFIs), provides subject matter expertise for specific areas of interest with the responsibility to post products to the client database or portal, maintain currency of the data, makes recommendations to validate existing information, and ensures plans, operations, and intelligence information are synchronized. Assesses gaps in information and develops recommendations and courses of action to collect, validate, and amplify information requirements for planning and operational use.

title: Counter-Radicalization/Intelligence Analyst
description: United States Special Operations Command Interagency Task Force (IATF)/J3-Fusion (J3-F) Division Task lead for 11 Jacobs Technology personnel and the Navanti Group’s Countering VEO Network Study under the Global Battlestaff and Program Support Task Order 004 contract. Lead Counter-Radicalization expert responsible for tailored intervention programs targeting those at-risk of extremist influence and programs that boost the capacity of Muslim faith leaders to win hearts and minds. Integrates interagency (IA) authorities and capabilities into a whole of government approach to discreet Special Operation Forces (SOF) problem sets in USCENTCOM’s area of responsibility. • Lead coordinator for the developing USSOCOM/USAID Joint Levant Iraq Project to synchronize SOF and IA efforts to develop a more comprehensive, common understanding of the risks and resilience factors in the Levant and Iraq. • Organized five academic-based tribal dynamics workshops at the University of South Florida (USF) focused on al-Qaeda influence on existing tribal power structures; achieved multi-million dollar funding for research to support SOF tribal engagement programs; and authored the memorandum of understanding between USSOCOM and USF. • Incorporated counter-narratives and unique amplification methods derived from J3-F workshops into strategic communications plans and IO programs to establish competing social networks to counter al-Qaeda ideology. • Coordinated with partner nations to non-kinetically target key terrorists which resulted in numerous Treasury/United Nations Security Council designations; INTERPOL Notices; and State Department Rewards for Justice nominations. • Enabled production of periodicals on al-Qaeda’s terrorism offenses in the US and their tactics to win hearts and minds in Yemen; reformed counter al-Qaeda policy and achieved White House, Homeland Security and SOF endorsement.

title: Senior Enlisted Leader/Chief High Value Individual Target Tracking Cell
description: National Security Agency (NSA) Cryptologic Services Group United States Central Command Senior Enlisted Leader for 350 deployed and Chief for 45 in-garrison personnel providing unprecedented Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) support to conventional and Special Operations elements directly engaged in combat. Exercised quality control of all SIGINT support to OIF and OEF Combatant Commanders. Responsible for a fusion cell and an Intelligence Surveillance and Reconnaissance asset that provided time-sensitive intelligence to Task Force-North in Iraq. • Developed and directed Target Tracking Cell fusing all sources of intelligence to target priority High-Value Individuals (HVI). Managed the development and production of targeting packages across USCENTCOM’s area of responsibility and the shaping of SIGINT support to the Expeditionary Force; numerous HVI’s captured/killed. • Deployed to Iraq as a SIGINT Analyst in support of a Special Operations Task Force. Directed the analytic and collection effort responsible for 100% of Task Force operations; established benchmark for targeting operations. • Personally fielded and managed high-visibility intelligence capability for tactical operations in Iraq. Drafted and applied the concept of operations and techniques, tactics and procedures; expanded NSA’s support to the warfighter.

title: Theater Collections Manager/Operations Chief
description: United States Pacific Command Joint Intelligence Center Pacific Certified all-source collection manager; supported 24/7 Operations/Intelligence watch by supervising the development and validation of Measurement and Signature intelligence (MASINT), Imagery Intelligence, SIGINT, and Human Intelligence collection requirements for USPACOM. Coordinated with the Defense Intelligence Agency, National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA), and theater collection managers/intelligence analysts to determine optimum collection methods. Performed additional duties as the collections exercise lead and systems administrator. • Coordinated all MASINT operations in support of Operation Enduring Freedom–Philippines; provided SOCPAC with unique MASINT collection capabilities and intelligence products that identified several unknown extremist locations. • Acquired and implemented NGA multi-spectral exploitation software for theater intelligence units; actions were instrumental in activating a regional MASINT node; dramatically increased theater intelligence capabilities. • Researched, authored, and developed training plan for unique MASINT capabilities; created Job Qualification Standard and on-line training interface; elevated PACOM as the world leader in the use of MASINT systems.

title: Intelligence Plans Non-Commissioned Officer
description: Joint Special Operations Command (JSOC) Detachment 1, 25th Intelligence Squadron Responsible for the integration of specialized intelligence for JSOC plans and programs. Augmented mission planning processes utilizing all-source intelligence and Information Warfare products and services for sensitive SOF missions. Analyzed and disseminated tailored threat data for injection into worldwide indications and warning systems. Maintained one hour response to National Command Authority (NCA) tasking. • Performed precise predictive analysis of jamming platforms against selected emitters for world-wide SOF air units directly supporting NCA missions and objectives; expanded mission flight capabilities and ensured air crew safety. • Lead planner and National Reconnaissance Office liaison for JSOC operations and NCA/Command Post exercises; maintained Electronic Order of Battle; streamlined situational awareness of weapon system emitters to battle staff. • As network and deployed Systems Administrator/INFOSEC Manager, ensured systems where secure and operated efficiently in garrison and while deployed; revalidated the unit’s information technology ability to support JSOC.

title: Aviation Logistics Specialist
company: System Studies and Simulation Inc. (S3 Inc)
description: Government Furnished Equipment (GFE) Property Manager, Primary Hand Receipt holder for all System Studies and Simulation Inc. (S3) GFE equipment and flight gear. Accounting of government property, as well as locally procured or leased government equipment utilized by S3 employees at Fort Hood. Provide supply support for expendable, durable, and non-expendable properties when requested by S3 employees and supported units. Establish procedures for processing requests, issue, receipt, turn-ins, lateral transfers, procurement, hand receipt updates, property accountability, Financial Liability Investigations of Property Loss (FLIPL), and Government Credit Card procurements procedures. Coordinate with the IT Section for automated data process (ADP) requirements, and ensure that life cycle replacements are conducted for outdated ADP. Ensure that all supply procedures are conducted in accordance with the Command Supply Discipline Program. Fulfills all tasks under ISO 9001:2008/AS9100, guidance for Management, Analysis, and Improvement.

title: Battalion Armorer / Supply Technician
description: I was the 3rd Battalion, 160th Special Operations Aviation Regiment (Airborne) Battalion Armorer. The Armsroom consists of over 1,000 weapons, over 2,000 weapon systems components, night vision equipment, and thermal imagery devices. I was responsible for the daily opening/closing, weekly, monthly, and annual sensitive items inventories. I conducted required quarterly, semiannual, and annual gauging and maintenance services required according to equipment technical manuals for all items stored in the Armsroom and recorded all maintenance and services on the Standard Army Maintenance System Enhanced (SAMS-E). I ensured that all weapons and components are properly maintained and ready for deployment and inspection at all times. I obtained specialized experience and knowledge of small arms and ammunition accountability procedures, regulations, repair, and cleaning of small arms. I was responsible for ordering, receiving, turning in and inventorying of all repair parts and bench stock used to repair the weapons and systems. I developed a network inventory system that all the Commanders had access to, so they could see the status of all their weapons and systems at all times.

title: Battalion S4 NCOIC - Senior Logistician
company: U.S. Army, 3rd Battalion, 160th Special Operations Aviation Regiment (Airborne)
description: I was the Senior Logistician for 3rd Battalion, 160th Special Operations Aviation Regiment (Airborne). I was responsible for planning, coordinated, and executed multiple and simultaneous worldwide logistical missions for the Armys only Special Operations Aviation Regiment in support of 3 Special Operations Aviation Companies, all equipped with Special Operation modified helicopters and 2 support companies totaling 580 personnel. I advised the Commander, staff and subordinate activities on the logistics status and the logistics support required and available for current or proposed operations. I supported operations in the SOUTHCOM and CENTCOM AOR supporting SOCSOUTH, SOCCENT, JSOC and Foreign SOF customers. Inspected and ensured that subordinate units complied with the Command Supply Discipline Program and adherence to logistics regulations and procedures. I received numerous commendable ratings for USASOC CSDP Inspections and USASOC IG Inspections. I served as the Government Purchase Card Approving Official (IMPAC) for 13 credit cards with a monthly purchase limit of $1.3 million for 3 years. I completed monthly GPC Approving Official certification on the US Bank CARE website and ensured that all purchase requests and receipts were properly stored according to regulations. Planned for and directed activities concerning the distribution, maintenance and utilization of unit equipment to include weapons, vehicles, electronics, communications, general and special purpose equipment. Oversaw the acquisition and transition of property to implement the new MH-47G aircraft, enabling the Battalion to be the first in the Army to battle test the airframe.

title: Military Sales Manager
description: Aspen Water Inc. is a company owned and operated by Ed and Kimberly Atchley based in Richardson, Texas. Ed has 20+ years experience working with the Special Operations Forces (SOF) and has provided water purification systems to the elite Special Forces and other SOF Units since the mid 1990's. These unique water purification systems were adopted by the SOF community because of their ease of use, dependability and reliability and relatively small weight and size footprint as compared to other small unit water purification systems (SUWP's). I became an end-user of these unique and simple to operate water purification systems while deploying with B Company, 2nd Battalion, 7th Special Forces Group (Airborne) to a location in Colombia, South America in support of "Operation Plan Colombia" from 1999-2002.

title: Command Public Health Advisor
description: To advise the USASFC Commander/USASFC Surgeon on all Public Health/Preventive Medicine issues within the Special Forces Groups, active and National Guard. Research and write SOP's, POI's, etc. that will be implemented throughout the Special Forces Command. Select, interview, assign and mentor junior Preventive Medicine/Public Health NCO's throughout the Special Forces Groups. Interface with US Army Special Operations Command (USASOC) and the Joint Special Operations Command (JSOC) medical personnel to implement policy throughout the Commands.

title: 2nd Battalion Public Health Advisor
description: Advise the Battalion Commander, Battalion Surgeon on all aspects of Preventive Medicine/Public Health issues in all areas the 7th SFG (A) operates in and/or deploys to. To travel with Battalion/Group personnel on Pre-deployment Site Surveys (PDSS) and provide medical intelligence on all health issues that is essential to the SF Operational Detachment Alpha (ODA's). Evaluate Host Nation medical facilities for standard of care, equipment and supplies. To assist in medical triage and treatment where required.

Operation One Voice, Inc is a not–for-profit corporation dedicated to raising funds and awareness for the financial needs of fallen and wounded Special Operations Forces (SOF).

title: GEOINT/ Imagery Intelligence Analyst
company: US Air Force; National Geospatial Intelligence Agency (NGA NST); USCENTCOM
description: • Collaborating intelligence efforts with multiple interagency and government organizations in a Multi-INT fusion team environment. • Exploiting national, tactical, and commercial imagery in support of NGA NST and USCENTCOM intelligence requirements. • Producing multiple geospatial products to provide visual representations depicting insurgent trends, tactics, and patterns throughout Afghanistan and Pakistan. • Producing imagery based products in order to update the Modernized Integrated Database (MIDB), local Imagery Product Library (IPL), and support databases for the Intelligence Community (IC). • Prioritizing, categorizing, and exploiting over 900 requests for information (RFIs) including 280 newly discovered installations to aid in operational planning and awareness for customers. • Conducting operational briefings for multiple VIP’s including Deputy Director of NGA, Deputy Director of DIA, USCENTCOM Commander, and USCENTCOM senior leaders. • Identifying, researching, and exploiting targets directly supporting the USCENTCOM mission objectives. • Utilizing all source intelligence research and national level imagery collection systems to provide the USCENTCOM Commander, component commands, and forward deployed operational forces with finished intelligence products, assessments, reports, imagery graphics, and fused ArcGIS imagery products. • Subject Matter Expert (SME) of Pakistan Air, Naval, and Ground Order of Battle providing over 4,600 intelligence products in direct support of theater operations. • NGA NST Division Service Member of the Quarter based on knowledge, performance, and leadership skills. • Authored eight national reports supporting NGA, USCENTCOM, and ISAF Commanders. • Wrote 55 Battle Damage Assessment (BDA) reports. • Lead training supervisor for team on-the-job training of current systems and production procedures. • Furnished over 800 imagery products in support of humanitarian assistance and disaster relief (HADR) efforts.

title: GEOINT/ Imagery Intelligence Analyst, IMS, MMS
company: United States Air Force; DGS-1; 480th ISR Wing; 30th IS
description: • Appointed as an Imagery Mission Supervisor (IMS) and MASINT Mission Supervisor (MMS) in charge of 25-person team responsible for exploitation and dissemination of GEOINT products from the U-2, Global hawk, Predator, and Reaper platforms. • IMS, Screener, and Analyst for Joint Special Operations Command (JSOC) mission cell. Provided time critical Full Motion Video (FMV) intelligence for SOF ground and air operations over-watch, force protection, HVI targeting, persistent surveillance/Patterns of Life (POL), and compound study. • Lead supervisor in charge of imagery analysis during 268 Special Operations missions in direct support of JSOC and 1,147 Predator, Reaper, U-2, and Global Hawk missions in direct support of operations in Iraq and Afghanistan. • Managed exploitation, reporting, quality control, and direct customer dissemination of imagery products derived from multiple soft-copy imagery sensors. • Supervised and conducted real-time voice and chat reporting resulting in 91 high value insurgents being detained. • Advised and recommended solutions to the Mission Operations Commander and the supported customer. • Led intelligence briefings for visiting VIP’s including Chairmen of the Joint Chiefs, two Air Force Chief of Staffs, Senior Master Sergeant of the Air Force, multiple wing level commanders, and other senior leaders. • Fused imagery intelligence with other Multi-INT personnel in a 24/7 watch team environment. • Imagery Report Editor charged with editing, correcting, and dissemination of intelligence reports directly to the requesting customer. • Mission screener for multiple imagery missions charged with tasking targets to the analysts and tracking targets ensuring each target completed for mission success and being the liaison between the analyst and the customers on the frontline. • Certified Instructor Rated Operator charged with training and certifying mission members.

title: GEOINT/ Imagery Intelligence Analyst
company: US Air Force; National Geospatial Intelligence Agency (NGA NST); USCENTCOM
description: • Collaborating intelligence efforts with multiple interagency and government organizations in a Multi-INT fusion team environment. • Exploiting national, tactical, and commercial imagery in support of NGA NST and USCENTCOM intelligence requirements. • Producing multiple geospatial products to provide visual representations depicting insurgent trends, tactics, and patterns throughout Afghanistan and Pakistan. • Producing imagery based products in order to update the Modernized Integrated Database (MIDB), local Imagery Product Library (IPL), and support databases for the Intelligence Community (IC). • Prioritizing, categorizing, and exploiting over 900 requests for information (RFIs) including 280 newly discovered installations to aid in operational planning and awareness for customers. • Conducting operational briefings for multiple VIP’s including Deputy Director of NGA, Deputy Director of DIA, USCENTCOM Commander, and USCENTCOM senior leaders. • Identifying, researching, and exploiting targets directly supporting the USCENTCOM mission objectives. • Utilizing all source intelligence research and national level imagery collection systems to provide the USCENTCOM Commander, component commands, and forward deployed operational forces with finished intelligence products, assessments, reports, imagery graphics, and fused ArcGIS imagery products. • Subject Matter Expert (SME) of Pakistan Air, Naval, and Ground Order of Battle providing over 4,600 intelligence products in direct support of theater operations. • NGA NST Division Service Member of the Quarter based on knowledge, performance, and leadership skills. • Authored eight national reports supporting NGA, USCENTCOM, and ISAF Commanders. • Wrote 55 Battle Damage Assessment (BDA) reports. • Lead training supervisor for team on-the-job training of current systems and production procedures. • Furnished over 800 imagery products in support of humanitarian assistance and disaster relief (HADR) efforts.

title: GEOINT/ Imagery Intelligence Analyst, IMS, MMS
company: United States Air Force; DGS-1; 480th ISR Wing; 30th IS
description: • Appointed as an Imagery Mission Supervisor (IMS) and MASINT Mission Supervisor (MMS) in charge of 25-person team responsible for exploitation and dissemination of GEOINT products from the U-2, Global hawk, Predator, and Reaper platforms. • IMS, Screener, and Analyst for Joint Special Operations Command (JSOC) mission cell. Provided time critical Full Motion Video (FMV) intelligence for SOF ground and air operations over-watch, force protection, HVI targeting, persistent surveillance/Patterns of Life (POL), and compound study. • Lead supervisor in charge of imagery analysis during 268 Special Operations missions in direct support of JSOC and 1,147 Predator, Reaper, U-2, and Global Hawk missions in direct support of operations in Iraq and Afghanistan. • Managed exploitation, reporting, quality control, and direct customer dissemination of imagery products derived from multiple soft-copy imagery sensors. • Supervised and conducted real-time voice and chat reporting resulting in 91 high value insurgents being detained. • Advised and recommended solutions to the Mission Operations Commander and the supported customer. • Led intelligence briefings for visiting VIP’s including Chairmen of the Joint Chiefs, two Air Force Chief of Staffs, Senior Master Sergeant of the Air Force, multiple wing level commanders, and other senior leaders. • Fused imagery intelligence with other Multi-INT personnel in a 24/7 watch team environment. • Imagery Report Editor charged with editing, correcting, and dissemination of intelligence reports directly to the requesting customer. • Mission screener for multiple imagery missions charged with tasking targets to the analysts and tracking targets ensuring each target completed for mission success and being the liaison between the analyst and the customers on the frontline. • Certified Instructor Rated Operator charged with training and certifying mission members.

title: SOT-A Team Member
description: - conduct SIGINT/EW operations in support of US Army SOCOM and JSOC missions, often operating in remote and denied areas - detect, monitor, and exploit threat communications through communications transmission intercept and direction finding - support SF ODAs with limited interrogation, translation, interpretation, and communications support. - deploy with, or independently in support of, SF ODAs to provide contingency, direct action, force protection, or MTT support - operate and train on advanced collection equipment provided by national intelligence agencies - train in tactical and fieldcraft techniques, infiltration and extraction techniques, and are certified in the same basic skills as SF ODAs, in addition to linguistic, International Morse Code (IMC), and SIGINT skills
skills: ["Microsoft Office", "Community Outreach", "Public Speaking", "PowerPoint", "Microsoft Word", "Military Experience", "Overseas Experience", "Team Leadership", "Team-oriented", "Adaptability", "Special Operations", "Special Operations...", "Intelligence Community", "SIGINT", "DoD Top Secret Clearance", "Foreign Languages", "Multicultural", "Tactical Planning", "Tactical Operations", "Tactical Communications", "Force Protection", "Joint Military...", "Interagency Coordination", "Counterterrorism", "Counter-narcotics", "Counterinsurgency", "Weapons & Tactics...", "Reconnaissance", "Surveillance", "Airborne School", "Mountaineering", "Maritime Operations", "Small Boat Operations", "Team Building", "Law Enforcement...", "Field Supervision", "Incident Command", "Field Training Officer", "Criminal Investigations", "First Responder", "Crime Prevention", "Emergency Vehicle...", "Physical Security", "Self Defense", "Weapons", "Homeland Security", "Dignitary Protection", "Certified Firearms...", "Police", "Active Shooter"]

title: CT Intelligence Analyst / Combined Theater – Analyst Vetted Relationally Structured (CT-AVRS)
description: Support the J2 (Intelligence) United States European Command (EUUCOM), Joint Intelligence Operations Center Europe (JIOCEUR) Analysis Center (JAC), Foreign Fighter (IDX), RAF Molesworth, GBR through standard and on demand RFIs requiring research and analysis of raw intelligence, the fusion of divergent information and provide finalized reporting in formats not limited to data in timeline, transaction and relational link analysis. Monitor un/classified sources of information, run serialized database queries and consult with other analysts. Extract data from serialized reporting and populate CT-AVRS DBs via direct data entry (DDE) or batch importing with essential elements of information. Write intelligence reports articles and assessments (evaluations, dossiers, etc.) and disseminate verbal and written coordination of analytical issues, with local, theater, and national intelligence organizations and write, prepare, and conduct briefings and presentations in the same venue. Worked with legal attaches (LEGAT) and NATO military on several investigations. Participated in EUCOM / Special Operations Command Europe (SOCEUR) / Joint Special Forces Command (JSOC) Exercise ‘Jackal Stone 2010’.

title: Deputy Commander
description: Leads 1,800+ military/civilians in 5 squadrons supporting space launch, range, installation, and expeditionary operations. Provides mission-essential support to 30 SW, 14 AF, over 30 associate units and the base community hosting 10,000 active duty, civilian & contractor personnel on the third largest Air Force Base. Supports ballistic missile testing, Western Range operations and maintenance, and expeditionary combat support operations through the support and services provided by security forces, civil engineer, logistics readiness, contracting, and force support squadrons. Develops and executes a $129M budget, manages $16.5B in resources, and maintains 2.1K facilities on 99K+ acres/154 square miles.

title: Commander
description: Leads the base-level communications unit on Wright-Patterson AFB, Ohio employing over 330 military, civilian and contract personnel. They operate and maintain the base network, telephone, cable infrastructure, land mobile radio, wireless, red switch & command and control systems and services worth $250M with a $15M annual budget supporting 27,000 customers, including HQ AFMC, Aeronautical Systems Center (ASC), two NAF equivalents, two wings & 60 associates units. They are also responsible for all Freedom of Information Act requests for AFMC.

title: Chief, IA Integration & Technology Branch
description: Leads 5 action officers overseeing the AF-wide Information Assurance impacts of evolving information technology and practices. Coordinates the Office of the Secretary of Defense, the Joint Staff, Combatant Command, and Air Staff to promote AF cryptographic modernization. Shapes Air Force doctrine, strategy and policy; drives standards, governance, innovation and architectures for AF information systems. Air Force representative to the Defense Information Assurance Security Accreditation Working Group.

title: AF Liaison Officer to ODNI
description: Air Force Representative to the Director of Nation Intelligence's Joint Interagency Cyber Task Force. Responsible for the oversight of the President's $17B Comprehensive National Cybersecurity Initiative (CNCI). Analyzes CNCI performance, budget, and personnel status; develops key assessments for the Office of Manpower & Budget, the National Security Council, and the Homeland Security Council. Oversees and assesses 19 interagency initiatives vital to securing DOD & other federal government computer networks. Advises senior decision-makers on cyber policy and assists developing DNI's quarterly CNCI assessment to President.

title: Chief, Information Assurance Division
description: Leads 11-person team providing information assurance and COMSEC support protecting JSOC’s $20M automated information systems (AIS) from computer network attacks. Develops policies and procedures to guarantee security of 4 separate garrison AISs providing connectivity to 50+ geographically separated organizations and 3 deployable networks supporting special operations forces worldwide. Manages 315 COMSEC hand receipt holders, 3,500+ short titles, and 1,585 COMSEC equip/keying material valued at $12.5M. Engineers technical solutions ensuring the continued confidentiality, integrity, and availability of JSOC information.

title: Chief, Airborne and Combat Support Systems Branch
description: Leads branch of nine personnel responsible for policy, guidance, and direction involving Air Traffic Control and Landing Systems (ATCALS), satellite communications, personal wireless communication systems, Core Automated Maintenance Systems/Reliability and Maintainability Information Systems (CAMS/REMIS) for communications and electronics, and spectrum management for the command. Provides maintenance oversight for over $50M of ATCALS, weather, and communications-electronics systems at 40 wings. Develops and implements plans for acquiring and fielding systems in support of airborne and combat support operations.

title: AEF Deployment Manager
description: Manages all mobilization and demobilization actions for 3,400 AFRC C&I reservists. Serves as liaison to gaining MAJCOMs and supported agencies for Reserve C&I augmentation. Program manager for command C&I plans and annexes in support of war, combat support, contingency, business, training, and exercises. Manages 890 C&I Unit Type Codes (UTCs) and $65M deployable equipment requirements, posturing 44 Reserve units against wartime taskings. C&I focal point for AEF requirements. Responsible for AFRC C&I unit combat readiness through the USAF Status of Resources and Training System (SORTS) reporting.

title: Executive Officer
description: Assistant and advisor to Director, Communications and Information on SOF communications matters. Plans, organizes, and directs the staff activities of three divisions, involving 66 people responsible for the employment of AFSOC communications forces and equipment. Manages, expedites, and continuously streamlines the overall flow of correspondence. Sets priorities, delegates, coordinates, and tracks directorate suspenses ensuring quality and timely products. Directs staff to take follow-up actions and works important staff issues directly. Informs director on personnel issues and morale. Acts as the director’ s personal representative to the staff, units, and outside agencies.

title: Flight Commander
description: Leads a combined team of 48 enlisted and contractor support personnel such as system administrators, network infrastructure systems operators, network security managers, local area network managers, and technical control managers in the conduct of operations for 30 information superiority platforms, supporting over 600 users. Directly supports all AFC2TIG events to include the CSAF’s Joint Expeditionary Force Experiment (JEFX), BLUE FLAG (BF), and multiservice operational tests and evaluations (MOT&E). Develops and implements operational mission requirements .an4 manages personnel and over $28 million of equipment resources that directly support the Air Force’s AOC testbed.

title: Chief, ACC Network Security
description: Leads 12-member network security team responsible for monitoring and defending the ACC Enterprise at 18 ACC bases and 10 geographically separated units, both deployed and in garrison. Plans and directs enterprise defense activity for the ACC Network Operations and Security Center (NOSC). Coordinates and conducts vulnerability assessments of ACC networks to detect and eliminate security faults. Disseminates, tracks, and provides assistance to base Network Control Centers with implementation of security advisories. Directs research and evaluation of commercial and DoD network security technologies for implementation to support ACC’ s warfighters.

title: Chief, Automated Systems Support Element
description: Lead a staff of 23 enlisted and civilian programmers involved in software development and maintenance for both small computers and for command and control systems. Plans, directs, and controls software design, coding, testing, and documentation. Distributes and balances workload among personnel to ensure timely completion of projects. Directs squadron responses to calls for immediate software assistance. Provides state-of-the-art technology solutions for implementing ACC mission requirements. Evaluates commercial-off-the-shelf software tools for suitability to customer’s needs. Enforces adherence to software processes, polices, and directives for new and existing systems.

title: Systems Analyst
description: Provided technical leadership to 35 software professionals throughout the software product development and maintenance cycles for ACC-wide small computer projects used by the ACC staff and units in planning, deploying, and employing warfighters. Analyzes new requirements, creates cost estimates, and develops high-level technical solutions. leads project members through detailed design, implementation, and testing of new requirements and system corrections.
